name: Marina Beach
description: India's longest urban beach along the Bay of Bengal, famous for evening walks, street food, and statues of historical figures. Ideal for sunset views and family outings.

reviews.review_text: Such a beautiful and well-maintained beach. We spent hours at Marina Beach and still wanted to stay longer.
Marina Beach is a must-visit in Chennai! The experience completely lived up to our expectations.

name: Kapaleeshwarar Temple
description: Iconic 7th-century Dravidian architecture temple in Mylapore dedicated to Lord Shiva, featuring a colorful gopuram and sacred tank.

reviews.review_text: Such a beautiful and well-maintained temple. We spent hours at Kapaleeshwarar Temple and still wanted to stay longer.
Kapaleeshwarar Temple is a must-visit in Chennai! The experience completely lived up to our expectations.

name: Fort St George
description: 17th-century British fort housing the Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly, museum with artifacts from colonial era.

reviews.review_text: We loved our time at Fort St George. It is a perfect spot for photography and soaking in the local heritage culture.
A very peaceful yet vibrant place. I would suggest visiting Fort St George early in the morning.

name: Elliot's Beach
description: Popular Besant Nagar beach known for calm waters, cafes, and Ashtalakshmi Temple nearby. Great for evening strolls and food.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Elliot's Beach was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in beach.
The atmosphere at Elliot's Beach is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: Government Museum
description: Oldest museum in India with Bronze Age artifacts, Egyptian mummies, and vast collections in Egmore.

reviews.review_text: We loved our time at Government Museum. It is a perfect spot for photography and soaking in the local museum culture.
A very peaceful yet vibrant place. I would suggest visiting Government Museum early in the morning.

name: Santhome Basilica
description: Minor basilica built over St. Thomas tomb, neo-Gothic architecture with stained glass windows.

reviews.review_text: Such a beautiful and well-maintained church. We spent hours at Santhome Basilica and still wanted to stay longer.
Santhome Basilica is a must-visit in Chennai! The experience completely lived up to our expectations.

name: Valluvar Kottam
description: Chariot-shaped memorial to poet Thiruvalluvar with 1330 inscriptions from Thirukkural.

reviews.review_text: We loved our time at Valluvar Kottam. It is a perfect spot for photography and soaking in the local monument culture.
A very peaceful yet vibrant place. I would suggest visiting Valluvar Kottam early in the morning.

name: Guindy National Park
description: Urban park with deer, birds, snake park, and walking trails near Raj Bhavan.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Guindy National Park was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in park.
The atmosphere at Guindy National Park is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: Parthasarathy Temple
description: 6th-century temple dedicated to Krishna as Parthasarathy, one of Chennai's oldest structures.

reviews.review_text: Such a beautiful and well-maintained temple. We spent hours at Parthasarathy Temple and still wanted to stay longer.
Parthasarathy Temple is a must-visit in Chennai! The experience completely lived up to our expectations.

name: Vivekananda House
description: Ice House where Swami Vivekananda stayed in 1897, now a museum displaying his life and teachings.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Vivekananda House was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in museum.
The atmosphere at Vivekananda House is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: Ashtalakshmi Temple
description: Seaside temple dedicated to eight forms of Lakshmi, popular for its serene location near Elliot's Beach.

reviews.review_text: We loved our time at Ashtalakshmi Temple. It is a perfect spot for photography and soaking in the local temple culture.
A very peaceful yet vibrant place. I would suggest visiting Ashtalakshmi Temple early in the morning.

name: Connemara Public Library
description: One of Asia's largest libraries with rare books, located within Government Museum complex.

reviews.review_text: Such a beautiful and well-maintained library. We spent hours at Connemara Public Library and still wanted to stay longer.
Connemara Public Library is a must-visit in Chennai! The experience completely lived up to our expectations.

name: Rippon Building
description: Neo-Gothic building serving as Chennai Corporation headquarters, known for its grand facade.

reviews.review_text: Such a beautiful and well-maintained architecture. We spent hours at Rippon Building and still wanted to stay longer.
Rippon Building is a must-visit in Chennai! The experience completely lived up to our expectations.

name: Pondy Bazaar T Nagar
description: Bustling shopping street in T Nagar famous for sarees, jewelry, electronics, and street food.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Pondy Bazaar T Nagar was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in shopping.
The atmosphere at Pondy Bazaar T Nagar is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: Kalakshetra Foundation
description: Renowned center for classical dance, music, and arts training with performances and campus.

reviews.review_text: We loved our time at Kalakshetra Foundation. It is a perfect spot for photography and soaking in the local cultural culture.
A very peaceful yet vibrant place. I would suggest visiting Kalakshetra Foundation early in the morning.

name: MGR Memorial
description: Memorial to former CM M.G. Ramachandran with his home, artifacts, and park.

reviews.review_text: We loved our time at MGR Memorial. It is a perfect spot for photography and soaking in the local memorial culture.
A very peaceful yet vibrant place. I would suggest visiting MGR Memorial early in the morning.

name: Anna Memorial
description: Memorial to DMK founder C.N. Annadurai on Marina Beach with museum and gardens.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Anna Memorial was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in memorial.
The atmosphere at Anna Memorial is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: Little Mount Shrine
description: Cave where St. Thomas hid, with footprint imprint and spring water.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Little Mount Shrine was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in church.
The atmosphere at Little Mount Shrine is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: St. Thomas Mount
description: Hill where St. Thomas was martyred, with ancient church and panoramic city views.

reviews.review_text: Such a beautiful and well-maintained church. We spent hours at St. Thomas Mount and still wanted to stay longer.
St. Thomas Mount is a must-visit in Chennai! The experience completely lived up to our expectations.

name: Natesan Park
description: Themed park with musical instruments sculptures, walking paths near Valluvar Kottam.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Natesan Park was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in park.
The atmosphere at Natesan Park is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: S.D.M. Podhu Dikshitlu Park
description: Musical-themed park with instrument installations and open air stage.

reviews.review_text: Visiting S.D.M. Podhu Dikshitlu Park was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in park.
The atmosphere at S.D.M. Podhu Dikshitlu Park is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: Semmozhi Poonga
description: Japanese-styled botanical garden with exotic plants, fountains, and conservatory.

reviews.review_text: Such a beautiful and well-maintained park. We spent hours at Semmozhi Poonga and still wanted to stay longer.
Semmozhi Poonga is a must-visit in Chennai! The experience completely lived up to our expectations.

name: Broken Bridge
description: Abandoned bridge over Adyar river offering views of estuary and birds.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Broken Bridge was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in scenic.
The atmosphere at Broken Bridge is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: Dr. Ambedkar Statue Park
description: Park featuring giant statue of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar and marina views.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Dr. Ambedkar Statue Park was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in monument.
The atmosphere at Dr. Ambedkar Statue Park is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: Annai Velankanni Church
description: Popular church dedicated to Our Lady of Health, attracts devotees year-round.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Annai Velankanni Church was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in church.
The atmosphere at Annai Velankanni Church is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: Madras High Court
description: Largest high court building in India with Indo-Saracenic architecture.

reviews.review_text: Visiting Madras High Court was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in architecture.
The atmosphere at Madras High Court is incredible. It gets a bit crowded during peak hours, but definitely worth a visit.

name: Parrys Corner
description: Historic commercial hub with wholesale markets, old buildings, and street vibe.

reviews.review_text: We loved our time at Parrys Corner. It is a perfect spot for photography and soaking in the local market culture.
A very peaceful yet vibrant place. I would suggest visiting Parrys Corner early in the morning.

name: Arignar Anna Zoological Park
description: Large zoo with animals in natural habitats, safari rides, located outside city.

reviews.review_text: We loved our time at Arignar Anna Zoological Park. It is a perfect spot for photography and soaking in the local zoo culture.
A very peaceful yet vibrant place. I would suggest visiting Arignar Anna Zoological Park early in the morning.

name: DakshinaChitra
description: Living museum showcasing South Indian heritage homes, crafts, and cultural shows.

reviews.review_text: Visiting DakshinaChitra was an absolute highlight of our trip! Highly recommend for anyone interested in museum.
